Class RevenueReport

Object
RevenueReport
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class RevenueReport extends Object implements Serializable
Class to store completed orders for archival purposes Prints collates and prints out order details during a given period specified during the function call
Author:
Chan Hui De, Elliot
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private ArrayList<Order>
    orderList
    ArrayList to store individual Order objects which are added when orders are completed

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    addToArchive​(Order order)
    used to add order to the Order ArrayList within the class
    boolean
    deleteFromArchive​(int orderID)
    Used to delete order from archive for loop to parse through entire list and delete only if orderID matches
    ArrayList<Order>
    getOrderList()
    Gets the arraylist which stores all completed orders
    void
    periodRevenue​(Instant start, Instant end)
    Takes in a start and end date Prints out all order contents within the specified period Prints number of each individual item as well as total revenue during this period Starts by duplicating all orders within date range into temporary arraylist Then calculates the total price for all these orders Next uses hashset to get a set of each unique foodtype and counts the number of each unique foodtype and prints the count
    void
    setOrderList​(ArrayList<Order> orderList)
    Used to set a new arrayList should not be used unless for debugging purposes as it overrides all previous records

      public boolean addToArchive​(Order order)

      Returns:
      true if successful, false if failed

    • deleteFromArchive

      public boolean deleteFromArchive​(int orderID)
      Used to delete order from archive for loop to parse through entire list and delete only if orderID matches
      Parameters:
      orderID - of order to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if successful, false if failed

    • setOrderList

      public void setOrderList​(ArrayList<Order> orderList)
      Used to set a new arrayList should not be used unless for debugging purposes as it overrides all previous records
      Parameters:
      orderList - to override current orderlist

    • periodRevenue

      public void periodRevenue​(Instant start, Instant end)
      Takes in a start and end date Prints out all order contents within the specified period Prints number of each individual item as well as total revenue during this period Starts by duplicating all orders within date range into temporary arraylist Then calculates the total price for all these orders Next uses hashset to get a set of each unique foodtype and counts the number of each unique foodtype and prints the count
      Parameters:
      start - date
      end - date
